snippet: Sheriff Ross Mirkarimi defended his department and said the federal authorities knew the suspect was in jail for two weeks before his release and the subsequent killing.
abstract: San Francisco Sheriff Ross Mirkarimi, who has lost most of his political allies over series of controversies, is subject of criticism after former prisoner Juan Francisco Lopez-Sanchez is implicated in fatal shooting of woman on Embarcadero pier; local law enforcement officials did not report release of Lopez-Sanchez, Mexican felon who has spent years in American jails and been deported five times, to Federal Immigration officials because of local ordinance forbidding them to do so.
lead_paragraph: Sheriff Ross Mirkarimi defended his department and said the federal authorities knew the suspect was in jail for two weeks before his release and the subsequent killing.

headline.main: Sheriff in San Francisco Faults Federal Authorities After Killing
headline.print_headline: Killing in San Francisco Turns Heat on Sheriff and the City’s Immigration Policies
